Questions.QuestionString: The function of the Fuel Tank Inerting System (FTIS) is: (level 1)
Answers: FTIS supplies inert gas into center tank to reduce flammability
FTIS supplies inert gas into wing tank to reduce flammability
FTIS supplies inert gas into all fuel tank to reduce flammability

Questions.QuestionString: The CSAS operates (level 1)
Answers: On ground to test system or in flight

Questions.QuestionString: What is the function of TCM? (level 1)
Answers: Controls the air temperature of the air to approximately 40deg.C
Controls the air temperature of the air to approximately 60deg.C
Controls the air temperature of the air to approximately 80deg.C

Questions.QuestionString: What is the function of IGGS? (level 1)
Answers: Discard Nitrogen Enriched Air (NEA) and collect Oxygen Enriched Air (OEA)
Discard Oxygen Enriched Air (OEA) and collect Nitrogen Enriched Air (NEA)
Discard Oxygen Enriched Air (OEA) and discard Nitrogen Enriched Air (NEA)

Questions.QuestionString: How IGGS Controller Unit can monitor the ASM health? (level 1)
In IGGS, what happen when air stream pressure less than 15PSI and temperature more than 85 deg.C? (level 1)
Answers: Isolation valve and dual flow shut- off valve close.
Isolation valve, dual- flow shut off valve and dual- flapper check valve close.

Questions.QuestionString: In flight, when FTIS is failure. what's correct ? (level 2)
Answers: ECAM warning message come into view.
There is no cockpit effect in flight but maintenance Status message occur on ground.

Questions.QuestionString: What sentence is correct? (level 1)
Answers: CSAS isolation valve: electrical controlled, pneumatic actuated.
CSAS isolation valve: electrical controlled, electrical actuated.
CSAS isolation valve: pneumatic controlled, pneumatic actuated.

Questions.QuestionString: What is the acceptable oxygen concentration percentage for commercials aircraft ? (level 1)
What controls the Conditioned Service Air System (CSAS)? (level 1)
What controls the Inert Gas System ( IGGS)? (level 2)
Purpose of Fuel Tank Inerting System is: (level 1)
Answers: Isolate the tank from fuel sytem within the conditions of tank leak
Protection to decrease the risk of fire and explosion in the tank
Increase Fleet Flammability Exposure to satisfactory levels

Questions.QuestionString: Fuel Tank Inerting System (FTIS) : (level 2)
Answers: Causes inert condition in the ullage space, refer above of fuel
Causes inert condition in the ullage space, refer below of fuel
Causes inert condition in the ullage space, refer surround of fuel

Questions.QuestionString: How many sub-sytem of the FTIS: (level 1)
What is supply a conditioned air stream of the correct temperature, pressure and flow (level 2)
Iner gas goes into the tank, it push the air with oxygen to (level 2)
Answers: Through the vent line of the fuel tank

Questions.QuestionString: Which component divide air into OEA and NEA: (level 2)
Which sensor data help to know ASM health, monitor FTIS performance one time for each flight during the cruise phase (level 1)
Where does the FTIS get air source from? (level 2)
Answers: The CSAS supplies the conditioned air to the Inert Gas Generation System (IGGS).

Questions.QuestionString: What is purpose of Fuel Tank Inerting System (FTIS)? (level 2)
Answers: To pressurize of the Fuel tank?
FTIS gives protection to decrease the risk of fire and explosion in the center fuel tank.
FTIS gives conditioned air to Air conditioning system?

Questions.QuestionString: What is the correct statement? (level 1)
Answers: The OEA goes out of the Air Separation Module to the fuel tank.
The OEA goes out of the Air Separation Module to the bleed system.
The OEA goes out of the Air Separation Module to the atmosphere.

Questions.QuestionString: What is the function of Air Separation Module? (level 2)
Answers: It divide the air into OEA and NEA streams.
It cool the air which go into the fuel tank.
None of above is correct answer.

Questions.QuestionString: Which computers involve in the FTIS controlling/monitoring? (level 1)
How to test/reset the Fuel Inert System? (level 2)
Answers: Test with bleed via MCDU only.
Test without bleed via MCDU only.
Test with bleed or without bleed via MCDU.

Questions.QuestionString: How does the FTIS operates? (level 2)
Answers: The FTIS operates automatically in flight.
The FTIS operates when the pilot select P/B in flight.
The FTIS operates automatically in flight and on ground.

Questions.QuestionString: The fuel tank is inert when the average oxygen concentration: (level 2)
Answers: Below 12% at sea level up to 3048 m (10000.18 ft.).
Below 15% at sea level up to 3048 m.
12% to 14% at sea level up to 3048 m.

Questions.QuestionString: The isolation valve closes if: (level 1)
Answers: The air stream pressure is less than 15 psi (1.0342 bar)
The air stream temperature is hotter than 85 deg.C

Questions.QuestionString: The oxygen sensor measures the oxygen concentration of the: (level 2)
FTIS operate on ground when: (level 2)
The Fuel Tank Inerting System (FTIS) reduces the amount of oxygen in the air within: (level 2)
The OEA is sent to the: (level 1)
The ICU control the valve to closes in case of: (level 2)
Which computer controlling the ASM (level 1)
Where is the temperature sensor? (level 2)
Answers: Downstream of IGGS Isolation Gate Valve

Questions.QuestionString: What is the cockpit effect when the FTIS is malfunctioning? (level 2)
Answers: There is Reminding memo message on upper ECAM.

Questions.QuestionString: Which computers involve in the FTIS controlling/monitoring? (level 1)
Where does the FTIS get air source from? (level 3)
Answers: From the air conditioning system directly from mixer unit.

Questions.QuestionString: Where is the oxygen sensor? (level 3)
What happen if the oxygen sensor senses an oxygen concentration higher 12% (level 1)
WHERE DOES THE FTIS GET AIR SOURCE FROM? (level 3)
Where does OEA go after flown ASM (Air Separate Module)? (level 3)
Answers: continues to inside system for ventilation center fuel tank
support further to crew oxygen system

Questions.QuestionString: What is D-ULPA (Double Ultra Low Partical Air) filter for? (level 3)
Answers: Remove dust from the air which going to air separate module
Separate air to be OEA (Oxygen Enriched Air) and NEA (Nitrogen Enriched Air)
Absorb moisture and dust from air before coming to air separate module

Questions.QuestionString: What is result if over temperature detected in the duct? (level 1)
Answers: IGGS still works with air is taken from another source

Questions.QuestionString: To test inert gas system, what configuration you have to set? (level 1)
Answers: align ADIRU1 then follow test with or without bleed

Questions.QuestionString: To test inert gas system with bleed, you set up? (level 1)
Answers: align ADIRU1, Bleed on, and Pack 1 on

Questions.QuestionString: When temperature is detected raising y sensor (level 3)
Answers: IGGS mode is not affected because it has only one mode

Questions.QuestionString: Temperature sensor has 2 channel analog and digital. What are those? (level 1)
Answers: Both analog and digital channels control IGGS modes which analog control is back-up
Digital channel controls isolation valve while analog channel controls IGGS modes
Digital channel controls IGGS mode while analog channel controls isolation valve

Questions.QuestionString: Which fuel tank is NEA functional in? (level 3)
Does fuel tank inert system work on ground? (level 1)
How fuel tank inert system works? (level 3)
Answers: By supply only nitrogen enriched air into fuel tank ullage space
By supply air mixed mainly between oxygen and nitrogen air into fuel tank ullage space
By supply only oxygen enriched air into fuel tank ullage space

Questions.QuestionString: What is the purpose of the Fuel Tank Inerting System (FTIS) ? (level 3)
Answers: The FTIS creates inert conditions in the ullage space of the fuel tank
The FTIS reduces the spark generation in the ullage space of the fuel tank
The FTIS reduces the fuel vapor concentration in the ullage space of the fuel tank

Questions.QuestionString: Where does the FTIS get air source from? (level 3)
IGGS discards: (level 3)
Answers: Oxygen Enriched Air (OEA) to the vent line of fuel tank

Questions.QuestionString: The Dual Flow and Shut-Off Valve(DFSOV) is used: (level 3)
Answers: To isolate the IGGS from the CSAS.
To shut-off and to give the correct flow for the related flight phase.
To isolate and to prevent reverse flow of fuel vapor from the tanks.

Questions.QuestionString: Air Separation Module provides air: (level 3)
What is the maximum acceptable oxygen concentration percentage for commercials aircraft ? (level 3)
Function of IGGS is: (level 3)
Answers: Correct temperature, pressure of condioned air stream and supply to CSAS
Remove oxygen from the airstream, and supply Oxygen Enriched Air (OEA) to the fuel tank
Remove Oxygen from the airstream, make Nitrogen Enriched Air (NEA) and Oxygen Enriched Air (OEA)

Questions.QuestionString: IGG discards: (level 3)
Answers: Oxygen Enriched Air (OEA) to the vent line of fuel tank

Questions.QuestionString: The Inert Gas Generation System ( IGGS) operates : (level 3)
Answers: On ground to test system or in flight.

Questions.QuestionString: The Dual Flow and Shut-Off Valve (DFSOV) is used: (level 3)
Answers: To isolate the IGGS from the CSAS.
To shut-off and to give the correct flow for the related flight phase.
To isolate and to prevent reverse flow of fuel vapor from the tanks.

Questions.QuestionString: Iner gas use in FTIS to make iner condions in fuel tank: (level 2)
What is the function of the Conditioned Service Air System (CSAS)? (level 2)
Answers: Supplies NEA( Nitrogen Enreached Air) into center fuel tank
Discharged OEA( Oxygen Enreached Air) outboard
Provides conditioned air to the IGGS( Inert Gas Generation System)

Questions.QuestionString: What controls the Inert Gas Generation System ( IGGS)? (level 2)
Where does the Conditioned Service Air System (CSAS) locate? (level 2)
Answers: Near the air conditioning pack #2 in the belly fairing on the righ hand side of the aircraft
Near the air conditioning pack #1 in the belly fairing on the left hand side of the aircraft
In the main landing gear bay

Questions.QuestionString: Where is the temperature sensor? (level 2)
Answers: Downstream of IGGS Isolation Gate Valve

Questions.QuestionString: What is the cockpit effect when the FTIS is malfunctioning? (level 2)
Answers: There is Reminding memo message on upper ECAM.
